title: Failure mechanisms of the Li(Ni0.6Co0.2Mn0.2)O2-Li4Ti5O12 lithium-ion batteries in long-time high-rate cycle
content:
RSC Adv., 2024, 14,13592-13604
DOI: 10.1039/D4RA00923A, Paper
Open Access
Â  This article is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 3.0 Unported Licence.
Yushuo Huang, Suyang Lu, Song Zhu, Minghao Su, Shilun Yang, Wenwen Zeng, Haoran Zhan, Ye Yang, Jun Mei
Through the analysis of tens of thousands of cycles in LTO pouch batteries at a high rate of 40C, we found that the failure was mainly caused by the consumption of electrolyte and the microcracks emerged on the cathode electrode materials NCM622.
